link.title: COVID-19 Round Rock ISD Campus Closures: What’s Next for Students?

meta.name: description
meta.content: From Monday, March 23 - Friday, April 3, Round Rock ISD is closed. All classes and activities are canceled. On Monday, you will be able to find learning activities to maintain and extend students’ learning on the District’s website. The link to access student learning will also be posted on the District’s Facebook and Twitter pages. Hard copy packets will be available at breakfast and lunch service locations. (More information below.) All school buildings are closed to students, staff, and parents. School nurses will contact parents of students who have medicine or medical supplies or devices to make arrangements for them to be picked up, if necessary. If you are not contacted by a school nurse by the end of day Tuesday and need to retrieve medicine, please email your campus principal. At this time, it is unknown when we will return to our traditional school operations. As Superintendent, I am in daily communication with the Texas Education Agency (TEA), superintendents from surrounding districts, and other public officials, and I pledge to keep you updated during this ever-evolving situation. The State Assessment of Academic Readiness (STAAR testing) has been canceled. The TEA Commissioner of Education has also submitted a waiver for Federal Accountability. Additional guidance from TEA on the Student Success Initiative (SSI)/grade placement committees will be provided. While schools are closed due to COVID-19 precautions,Round Rock ISD Food Services will provide curbside meals for children under the age of 19 at several locations throughout the District. Please visit the Food Services website for service times and locations.

meta.content: Covid-19, student learning, distant learning, learn at home, student meal service, school nurse, STAAR test,

div.h1: COVID-19 Campus Closures: What’s Next for Students?

img.alt: COVID-19 Campus Closures: What’s Next for Students?

div.p: I know this week was not what you had anticipated. I want to assure you that District staff has been hard at work throughout Spring Break. We have a plan in place to provide resources to students over the next two weeks while developing a strategy to support at-home learning in the event that campuses remain closed beyond Friday, April 3.

p.strong: Here is important information regarding where we stand today:
p.br: From Monday, March 23 – Friday, April 3, Round Rock ISD is closed. All classes and activities are canceled. On Monday, you will be able to find learning activities to maintain and extend students’ learning on the District’s website. The link to access student learning will also be posted on the District’s Facebook and Twitter pages. Hard copy packets will be available at breakfast and lunch service locations. (More information below.)

div.p: All school buildings are closed to students, staff, and parents. School nurses will contact parents of students who have medicine or medical supplies or devices to make arrangements for them to be picked up, if necessary. If you are not contacted by a school nurse by the end of day Tuesday and need to retrieve medicine, please email your campus principal.

At this time, it is unknown when we will return to our traditional school operations. As Superintendent, I am in daily communication with the Texas Education Agency (TEA), superintendents from surrounding districts, and other public officials, and I pledge to keep you updated during this ever-evolving situation.

The State Assessment of Academic Readiness (STAAR testing) has been canceled. The TEA Commissioner of Education has also submitted a waiver for Federal Accountability. Additional guidance from TEA on the Student Success Initiative (SSI)/grade placement committees will be provided.

While schools are closed due to COVID-19 precautions, Round Rock ISD Food Services will provide curbside meals for children under the age of 19 at several locations throughout the District. Please visit the Food Services website for service times and locations.
For the latest updates, please visit the District’s COVID-19 information page.

Thank you for your support and patience during these challenging and ever-evolving times. I will continue to be in communication with you as we receive more information, make decisions, and plan for the possibility of long-term at-home learning.

I am inspired and humbled by the outpouring of support and willingness to help our students through this unprecedented situation. I am prouder than ever to be the Superintendent of Schools for Round Rock ISD and to serve our extraordinary students, staff, and families.

Respectfully,
Steve Flores, Ph.D.
Superintendent of Schools

p.span: Estimadas familias de Round Rock ISD:

Sé que esta semana no fue lo que habíamos anticipado. Quiero asegurarles que el personal del Distrito ha trabajado duro durante las vacaciones de primavera. Tenemos un plan para proporcionar recursos a los estudiantes durante las próximas dos semanas mientras desarrollamos una estrategia para apoyar el aprendizaje en el hogar en caso de que los edificios escolares permanezcan cerrados más allá del viernes 3 de abril 2020.
A continuación encontrarán información importante sobre dónde nos encontramos hoy:
Comenzando el lunes 23 de marzo hasta el viernes 3 de abril,
o
. Todas las clases y actividades están canceladas. El lunes 23 de marzo, podrán encontrar actividades de aprendizaje para mantener y ampliar el aprendizaje de los estudiantes en el
. El enlace para acceder al aprendizaje de los estudiantes también se publicará en las páginas de
Facebook
y
Twitter
del Distrito. Además tendremos paquetes impresos cuales estarán disponibles en las
ubicaciones de servicio de desayuno y almuerzo
(Más información a continuación).

Todos los edificios escolares permanecerán cerrados para estudiantes, personal y padres. Las enfermeras escolares se comunicarán con los padres de los estudiantes que tienen medicamentos o suministros o dispositivos médicos para hacer arreglos para que los recojan, si es necesario. Si una enfermera de la escuela no se comunica con Usted para el martes al final del día y necesita recuperar medicamentos, envíe un correo electrónico al director/directora de su escuela.

En este momento, se desconoce cuándo volveremos a nuestras operaciones escolares normales. Como Superintendente, estoy en comunicación diaria con la Agencia de Educación de Texas (TEA), los superintendentes de los distritos vecinos y otros funcionarios públicos, y prometo mantenerlos informados durante esta situación en constante evolución.
La Evaluación Estatal de Preparación Académica (prueba STAAR) han sido canceladas.

El Comisionado de Educación de TEA también ha presentado una exención de responsabilidad federal. Se proporcionará orientación adicional de TEA sobre la Iniciativa de Éxito Estudiantil (SSI) / comités de colocación de grado.

p.b: Mientras las escuelas están cerradas debido a las precauciones de COVID-19, los Servicios de Alimentos de Round Rock ISD proporcionarán comidas en la acera para niños menores de 19 años en varios lugares del Distrito
p.span: . Visite el
para conocer los horarios y lugares de servicio.
Para obtener las últimas actualizaciones, visite la

a.span: página de información COVID-19 del Distrito.

p.span: Gracias por su apoyo y paciencia durante estos tiempos desafiantes y en constante evolución. Continuaré comunicándome con usted a medida que recibamos más información, tomemos decisiones y planifiquemos la posibilidad de un aprendizaje a largo plazo en el hogar.

Me siento inspirado y humillado por la gran cantidad de apoyo y disposición para ayudar a nuestros estudiantes a superar esta situación sin precedentes. Estoy más orgulloso que nunca de ser el Superintendente de Escuelas de Round Rock ISD y de servir a nuestros extraordinarios estudiantes, personal y familias.
Respetuosamente,
Steve Flores, Ph.D.
Superintendente de Escuelas
